entry.title: Bitcoin Investor Sentiment Witnesses Bullish Shift â€“ BTC Price To $70,000 Soon?
entry.summary:
After hitting an all-time high of $73,737 in mid-March, the price of Bitcoin has not been able to sustain itself at a high level of vigor and strength. The premier cryptocurrency did, in fact, enter a new era with the April halving event, but its price performance in the past weeks has yet to reflect this.
However, Bitcoin enjoyed a stroke of fortune in the past week, with its price climbing above $67,000 for the first time in nearly a month. Although the sentiment around the crypto market and its leader has not been particularly encouraging in the last few weeks, the recent bullish rally seems to be driving a shift in that regard.
Can Bullish Sentiment Push BTC Price To $70,000?

entry.title: DOJ Arrests Two In Connection With $73 Million Crypto Laundering Scheme
entry.summary:
United States authorities have charged two foreign nationals for laundering $73 million in cryptocurrency investment scams, commonly known as â€œpig butchering.â€ This development was announced by the US Department of Justice (DOJ) on Friday, with an indictment unsealed in the Central District of California against the two suspects.
$73 Million Crypto Laundering Scheme Busted
In a press release, the DOJ confirmed the identity of both suspects in a cryptocurrency laundering case to be two Chinese nationals named Daren Li and Yicheng Zhang, aged 42 years and 38, respectively. Li, a dual citizen of China and St. Kitts and Nevis, was apprehended on April 12 at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport and subsequently transferred to the Central District of California. Meanwhile, Zhaâ€¦

entry.title: Phony Philanthropy? Notcoinâ€™s $6.8 Million Gift To Telegram Founder Rings Alarm Bells
entry.summary:
The burgeoning world of cryptocurrency continues to grapple with issues of transparency, with a recent donation raising eyebrows across the digital currency landscape. Notcoin, a brand new play-to-earn game built on the Telegram messaging platform, sent a hefty $6.8 million worth of its own tokens (NOT) to Telegram founder Pavel Durov.
While framed as a gesture of appreciation for Telegramâ€™s contributions to the crypto space, the unorthodox move has triggered a wave of suspicion within the crypto community.
Lack Of Transparency Breeds Insider Trading Fears
The core of the controversy lies in Notcoinâ€™s lack of clear communication. When the donation was announced, the projectâ€™s team failed to disclose a crucial detail: donors who participated in the â€œthank youâ€ campaign would receiveâ€¦

entry.title: Digital Yuan Goes Cross-Border: Hong Kong Unveils e-CNY Wallets For Local Users
entry.summary:

This development, part of a collaboration with the Peopleâ€™s Bank of China (PBoC), marks a milestone in â€œfacilitatingâ€ cross-border transactions between Hong Kong and Mainland China.
Introducing these wallets is expected to expand the usage of Chinaâ€™s digital yuan, or e-CNY, supporting more organized and direct payments without needing a Mainland bank account.
Expanding Digital Yuan Use
The HKMA revealed that this initiative aims to broaden the scope of digital currency use among residents and â€œenhance the interoperabilityâ€ of financial systems across borders. Residents can easily set up thâ€¦

entry.title: Crypto Influencer â€˜T.J. Stoneâ€™ Pleads Guilty To $1M Wire Fraud Scheme
entry.summary:
In a Brooklyn federal court on Thursday, crypto personality Thomas John Sfraga, also known as â€œTJ Stoneâ€, pleaded guilty to wire fraud charges for defrauding over a dozen victims out of more than $1.3 million.
Fictitious Scheme Exposed
According to the US Department of Justice, from 2019 to 2022, Sfraga â€œfalselyâ€ presented himself as the owner and principal of several businesses, including Vandelay Contracting Corp. and Build Strong Homes LLC. He also claimed to be a â€œserial entrepreneurâ€ with experience in real estate development, media relations, podcasting, and cryptocurrencies.
In this capacity, Sfraga allegedly convinced victims, many of them located in Brooklyn, Staten Island, and Long Island, to loan him money or invest in what turned out to be fraudulent schemes.
This inâ€¦

entry.title: Here Are The Latest Shiba Inu Developments You Should Be Aware Of
entry.summary:
There have been a number of significant developments coming out of the Shiba Inu ecosystem recently and it can be hard to keep up. So, we have compiled a list of the most important developments that community members should be aware of at this time.
ShibaSwap Launches On Shibarium Blockchain The ShibaSwap decentralized exchange (DEX) had been on the Ethereum blockchain since its launch and was yet to migrate the Shibarium, the Layer 2 blockchain developed by the Shiba Inu team. However, the time has finally come as the team has announced that the DEX is finally moving to Shibarium.
As Bitcoinist reported, the integration of the ShibaSwap DEX with the Shibarium network comes with a number of features. One of the major ones is the reduced fees that come with carrying out transactions â€¦

entry.title: Nigerian Court Denies Bail To Binance Executive Accused Of $35M Laundering Charges
entry.summary:
The worldâ€™s largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, has been embroiled in a complex legal battle with Nigerian authorities over allegations of money laundering, tax evasion, and currency speculation.
Two senior Binance executives are at the center of the dispute: Tigran Gambaryan, the head of financial crime compliance, and Nadeem Anjarwalla, the regional manager for Binance in Africa. The Nigerian government has charged both men with a litany of financial crimes.
Binance Embroiled In High-Stakes Legal Battle
The legal saga began earlier this year when Gambaryan traveled to Nigeria to participate in talks with the government about Binanceâ€™s operations in the country. However, upon arrival, he was promptly arrested and incarcerated.
A Nigerian court has dealt another blow to Binaâ€¦
